A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
"Original Fan" over here. Loved the original\, even enjoyed some of TFA. Was looking forward to some characters being developed\, such as Finn. His part in the movie feels pointless\, and same with his new friend Rose. Since these new movies lack any romance\, looks like they were able to slap in a hot and heavy smooch between the two!
Horrible character development.
Old heroes ruined. Leia's float scene was so cheesy and lame.
In the force awakens\, I liked how Abrams made the force a spiritual thing again\, not just acrobats. But this movie took the spiritual aspect to a whole new horrible level. The way Rey and Kyle communicate didn't feel right. That ain't STAR WARS. Glad the audience agrees with me. These "critics" are too careful not to give feminists a hard time. 
The series has turned a bad ass rebellion into a cowardly group that runs away and fights "smarter". That's what happens when you let women take the reigns.
As a women myself\, I could care less about movies pushing social justice and feminism. I just want to see macho badasses go at it like they used to when movies were good. 
As I watched the movie\, I could feel the feminist and social justice agenda. Made me enjoy it less. 
Just make the characters have good development so I don't notice the "agenda" next time.
